Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep][2023.01.26]RI of dev into main" (#9362) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "[TFM] net6.0-windows7.0 compatibility added." (#9364) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
## Description
We use NuGet client sdk in order to create a compatibility matrix for displaying TFMs on nuget.org. Currently there is no knowledge on nuget client sdk on what net5+ platform version exists (like net6.0-windows7.0) and they are not computed.

## Changes
* net6.0-windows7.0 compatibility has been hardcoded with known values.
* This compatibility will only show if a package contains that specific TFM in their assets.

## Screenshots

![Before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17834924/214958483-83ed5463-ce87-4a93-86e0-de2ceedfe872.png)

![After](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17834924/214958491-6f98386b-02b2-4d79-b40c-baa369998355.png)

## Notes
* Why doesn't these PR cover all the other versions?
  * We don't know the exhaustive compatibility on platform versions. 
* For further improvements we will need to collaborate with NuGet client and dotnet sdk: https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4730. 

Addresses: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9337

# Gallery
## Changes
* https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/9361
* https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/9357
* https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/9342
* https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/9348
* https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/9349

## Progress
* [ ] Merge PR: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/9362
* [ ] Build:
* [ ] Release
* [ ] DEV
* [ ] INT
* [ ] PROD

# Stats.CreateAzureCdnWarehouseReports job
## Changes
* https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/pull/1124

## Progress
* [ ] Release: https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_releaseProgress?_a=release-pipeline-progress&releaseId=1424727
* [x] DEV
* [ ] INT
* [ ] PROD

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[ReleasePrep][2023.01.26]RI of dev into main" (#9362) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "More telemetry for downloads service." (#9361) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Related to https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9352.

We have a weird situation when downloads.v1.json, Gallery DB and Search service all align on a downloads count for a certain package, yet the number displayed in the package list is different.

It should come from DB: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/c1ccf24a931fb3e048e23c484f663580e906f30d/src/NuGetGallery/Helpers/ViewModelExtensions/PackageViewModelFactory.cs#L58
But some EF interception magic happens and it is actually ends up being populated from data retrieved by [CloudDownloadCountService](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/main/src/NuGetGallery/Services/CloudDownloadCountService.cs) and it is unclear if it actually refreshes the statistics data fully. To investigate the issue from that angle, more telemetry is added to that service.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Transitive pinning not working" (#12391) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

7.0.102

### Worked before?

Don't know

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

I can't get transitive pinning to work. I have created the following minimal repro.

csproj file:
```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
    <PropertyGroup>
        <TargetFramework>net7.0</TargetFramework>
    </PropertyGroup>
    <ItemGroup>
        <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.Data.SqlClient" />
    </ItemGroup>
</Project>
```

Directory.Packages.props:
```xml
<Project>
    <PropertyGroup>
        <ManagePackageVersionsCentrally>true</ManagePackageVersionsCentrally>
        <CentralPackageTransitivePinningEnabled>true</CentralPackageTransitivePinningEnabled>
    </PropertyGroup>
    <ItemGroup>
        <PackageVersion Include="Microsoft.Data.SqlClient" Version="5.0.1" />
        <PackageVersion Include="System.Drawing.Common" Version="7.0.0" />
    </ItemGroup>
</Project>
```

Executing `dotnet list  package --vulnerable --include-transitive` on the above project gives the following output:
```
The following sources were used:
   https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
   C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\NuGetPackages\

Project `TransitivePinning` has the following vulnerable packages
   [net7.0]: 
   Transitive Package           Resolved   Severity   Advisory URL
   > System.Drawing.Common      5.0.0      Critical   https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rxg9-xrhp-64gj
```

Version 5.0.0 of System.Drawing.Common is used instead of version 7.0.0 as specified in Directory.Packages.props.

The only way of avoiding the vulnerable version is to add an explicit reference to the package in the csproj file. 

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

### Repro Steps & Context

I can't get transitive pinning to work. I have created the following minimal repro.

csproj file:

```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
```

```xml
    </PropertyGroup>
    <ItemGroup>
        <PackageVersion Include="Microsoft.Data.SqlClient" Version="5.0.1" />
        <PackageVersion Include="System.Drawing.Common" Version="7.0.0" />
    </ItemGroup>
</Project>
```

Executing `dotnet list  package --vulnerable --include-transitive` on the above project gives the following output:
```
The following sources were used:

Project `TransitivePinning` has the following vulnerable packages
   [net7.0]:
```

Version 5.0.0 of System.Drawing.Common is used instead of version 7.0.0 as specified in Directory.Packages.props.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "MSB4066 "The attribute 'Version' in element <PackageReference> is unrecognized." error in NuGet CLI 6.4.0" (#12390) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

nuget.exe 6.4.0

### Worked before?

6.3.1

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Create a .csproj file with this content:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Project ToolsVersion="12.0" DefaultTargets="Build" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003">
  <Import Project="$(MSBuildExtensionsPath)\$(MSBuildToolsVersion)\Microsoft.Common.props" Condition="Exists('$(MSBuildExtensionsPath)\$(MSBuildToolsVersion)\Microsoft.Common.props')" />
  <PropertyGroup>
    <Configuration Condition=" '$(Configuration)' == '' ">Debug</Configuration>
    <Platform Condition=" '$(Platform)' == '' ">AnyCPU</Platform>
    <ProjectGuid>{A4366E0A-29F0-4F5E-B6CD-C35F022FB924}</ProjectGuid>
    <OutputType>Library</OutputType>
    <AppDesignerFolder>Properties</AppDesignerFolder>
    <RootNamespace>NUnit2PassingTest</RootNamespace>
    <AssemblyName>NUnit2PassingTest</AssemblyName>
    <TargetFrameworkVersion>v4.5</TargetFrameworkVersion>
    <FileAlignment>512</FileAlignment>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <PropertyGroup Condition=" '$(Configuration)|$(Platform)' == 'Debug|AnyCPU' ">
    <DebugSymbols>true</DebugSymbols>
    <DebugType>full</DebugType>
    <Optimize>false</Optimize>
    <OutputPath>bin\Debug\</OutputPath>
    <DefineConstants>DEBUG;TRACE</DefineConstants>
    <ErrorReport>prompt</ErrorReport>
    <WarningLevel>4</WarningLevel>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <PropertyGroup Condition=" '$(Configuration)|$(Platform)' == 'Release|AnyCPU' ">
    <DebugType>pdbonly</DebugType>
    <Optimize>true</Optimize>
    <OutputPath>bin\Release\</OutputPath>
    <DefineConstants>TRACE</DefineConstants>
    <ErrorReport>prompt</ErrorReport>
    <WarningLevel>4</WarningLevel>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <Reference Include="nunit.framework, Version=2.6.4.14350, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=96d09a1eb7f44a77, processorArchitecture=MSIL">
      <HintPath>packages\NUnit.2.6.4\lib\nunit.framework.dll</HintPath>
      <Private>True</Private>
    </Reference>
    <Reference Include="System" />
    <Reference Include="System.Core" />
    <Reference Include="System.Xml.Linq" />
    <Reference Include="System.Data.DataSetExtensions" />
    <Reference Include="Microsoft.CSharp" />
    <Reference Include="System.Data" />
    <Reference Include="System.Xml" />
  </ItemGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <Compile Include="TestFixture.cs" />
    <Compile Include="Properties\AssemblyInfo.cs" />
  </ItemGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <None Include="packages.config" />
  </ItemGroup>
  <Import Project="$(MSBuildToolsPath)\Microsoft.CSharp.targets" />
  <!-- To modify your build process, add your task inside one of the targets below and uncomment it. 
       Other similar extension points exist, see Microsoft.Common.targets.
  <Target Name="BeforeBuild">
  </Target>
  <Target Name="AfterBuild">
  </Target>
  -->
</Project>
```
2. Run `NuGet.exe restore PATH_TO_CSPROJ_FILE -SolutionDirectory PATH_TO_CSPROJ_DIRECTORY`
3. Note you'll see this error:
```
C:\Users\appveyor\AppData\Local\Temp\1\NuGetScratch\ztu053ia.0tn.nugetrestore.targets(199,25): error MSB4066: The attribute "Version" in element <PackageReference> is unrecognized. [C:\Users\appveyor\AppData\Local\Temp\1\NuGetScratch\unf55omt.uun.nugetinputs.targets]
```

### Verbose Logs

```shell

PassingTest.csproj -solutiondirectory .\Test\assemblies\NUnit2PassingTest -verbosity detailed

Local\Temp\1\NuGetScratch\muiuyf0f.qw2.nugetrestore.targets" /p:RestoreUseCustomAfterTargets="True" /p:DisableCheckingDuplicateNuGetItems="True" /p:RestoreTaskAssemblyFile="C:\projects\whiskey\NuGet.CommandLine.6.4.0\tools\NuGet.exe" /p:Res
toreSolutionDirectory="C:\projects\whiskey\Test\assemblies\NUnit2PassingTest\\" /p:SolutionDir="C:\projects\whiskey\Test\assemblies\NUnit2PassingTest\\" /p:RestoreBuildInParallel="False" /p:RestoreUseSkipNonexistentTargets="False"

ms.d1c.nugetinputs.targets]
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "RestorePackagesConfig doesn't restore from packages.config" (#11329) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
---
**Issue moved from dotnet/msbuild#6982**
- Please respond to @TymurGubayev.

---

_From @TymurGubayev on Friday, October 22, 2021 2:52:08 PM_

<!-- This is a template that helps us provide quicker feedback. Please use any relevant sections and delete anything you don't need. -->

### Issue Description
<!--
* Please include a clear and concise description of the problem.
-->
Calling `msbuild` with `-t:restore -p:RestorePackagesConfig=true` as describe in the [docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/msbuild-targets#restoring-packagereference-and-packagesconfig-projects-with-msbuild) results in NU1503 warning ("The project file may be invalid or missing targets required for restore.") Calling `nuget restore` works as expected.

### Steps to Reproduce
<!--
* Include as much of the following as possible:

* A minimal sample project that reproduces the issue.
* Your zipped project.
* IDE / CLI steps to create the project and reproduce the behaviour.
* Your command line invocation
-->

* A minimal sample project that reproduces the issue:

`proj.csproj`:
```xml
<Project ToolsVersion="Current" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <FileUpgradeFlags>
    </FileUpgradeFlags>
    <UpgradeBackupLocation>
    </UpgradeBackupLocation>
    <OldToolsVersion>2.0</OldToolsVersion>
    <ProjectGuid>{BAF51480-4B90-454A-96F5-E63A05A486E0}</ProjectGuid>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <Reference Include="Rhino.Mocks, Version=3.6.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=0b3305902db7183f, processorArchitecture=MSIL">
      <HintPath>packages\RhinoMocks.3.6.1\lib\net\Rhino.Mocks.dll</HintPath>
      <Private>True</Private>
    </Reference>
  </ItemGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <None Include="packages.config" />
  </ItemGroup>
  <Target Name="Build">
    <Message Importance="High" Text="Building the project" />
  </Target>
</Project>
```
`packages.config`:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<packages>
  <package id="RhinoMocks" version="3.6.1" targetFramework="net40" />
</packages>
```
`Complete.sln`:
```sln
Microsoft Visual Studio Solution File, Format Version 12.00
# Visual Studio Version 16
VisualStudioVersion = 16.0.29709.97
MinimumVisualStudioVersion = 10.0.40219.1
Project("{FAE04EC0-301F-11D3-BF4B-00C04F79EFBC}") = "proj", "proj.csproj", "{BAF51480-4B90-454A-96F5-E63A05A486E0}"
EndProject
Global
	GlobalSection(SolutionConfigurationPlatforms) = preSolution
		Debug|x86 = Debug|x86
	EndGlobalSection
	GlobalSection(ProjectConfigurationPlatforms) = postSolution
		{BAF51480-4B90-454A-96F5-E63A05A486E0}.Debug|x86.ActiveCfg = Debug|x86
		{BAF51480-4B90-454A-96F5-E63A05A486E0}.Debug|x86.Build.0 = Debug|x86
	EndGlobalSection
	GlobalSection(SolutionProperties) = preSolution
		HideSolutionNode = FALSE
	EndGlobalSection
EndGlobal
```

* zipped project: [TestMsBuildRestore.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/msbuild/files/7398544/TestMsBuildRestore.zip)

* CLI steps to create the project and reproduce the behaviour:

Try msbuild:

> PS C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRestore> msbuild -p:RestorePackagesConfig=true -t:restore -p:Configuration=Debug`;Platform="x86" ".\Complete.sln"
> 
> Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 16.11.1+3e40a09f8 for .NET Framework
> Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
> 
> Building the projects in this solution one at a time. To enable parallel build, please add the "-m" switch.
> Build started 22.10.2021 16:43:06.
> Project "C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRestore\Complete.sln" on node 1 (Restore target(s)).
> ValidateSolutionConfiguration:
>   Building solution configuration "Debug|x86".
> C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRestore\proj.csproj : warning NU1503: Skipping restore for project 'C:\Users\myuser\TestMs
> BuildRestore\proj.csproj'. The project file may be invalid or missing targets required for restore. [C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRest
> ore\Complete.sln]
> _GetAllRestoreProjectPathItems:
>   Determining projects to restore...
> C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Professional\Common7\IDE\CommonExtensions\Microsoft\NuGet\NuGet.targets(131,5): warning : Unabl 
> e to find a project to restore! [C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRestore\Complete.sln]
> Done Building Project "C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRestore\Complete.sln" (Restore target(s)).
> 
> 
> Build succeeded.
> 
> "C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRestore\Complete.sln" (Restore target) (1) ->
> (_FilterRestoreGraphProjectInputItems target) ->
>   C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRestore\proj.csproj : warning NU1503: Skipping restore for project 'C:\Users\myuser\Test
> MsBuildRestore\proj.csproj'. The project file may be invalid or missing targets required for restore. [C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRe 
> store\Complete.sln]
> 
> 
> "C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRestore\Complete.sln" (Restore target) (1) ->
> (Restore target) -> 
>   C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Professional\Common7\IDE\CommonExtensions\Microsoft\NuGet\NuGet.targets(131,5): warning : Una 
> ble to find a project to restore! [C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRestore\Complete.sln]
> 
>     2 Warning(s)
>     0 Error(s)
> 
> Time Elapsed 00:00:00.31

Notice there is no `packages` folder present.

> PS C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRestore> nuget restore .\Complete.sln
> 
> MSBuild auto-detection: using msbuild version '16.11.1.47101' from 'C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\2019\Professional\MSBuild\Current\bin'.
> Restoring NuGet package RhinoMocks.3.6.1.
> Adding package 'RhinoMocks.3.6.1' to folder 'C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRestore\packages'
> Added package 'RhinoMocks.3.6.1' to folder 'C:\Users\myuser\TestMsBuildRestore\packages'
> 
> NuGet Config files used:
>     C:\Users\myuser\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config
>     C:\Program Files (x86)\NuGet\Config\Microsoft.VisualStudio.Offline.config
> 
> Feeds used:
>     C:\Users\wmdustgv\.nuget\packages\
>     https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
>     C:\Users\Public\Documents\Infragistics\NuGet\
>     C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\NuGetPackages\
> 
> Installed:
>     1 package(s) to packages.config projects

Notice there is a `packages` folder present.

### Expected Behavior
<!--
* The expected output or behavior.
-->
I expect `msbuild -t:restore -p:RestorePackagesConfig=true` to actually restore NuGet packages from a `packages.config` file.

### Versions & Configurations
<!--
* In a Visual Studio developer command prompt, run `msbuild -version` and paste the output here.
* If applicable, include the version of the tool that invokes MSBuild (Visual Studio, dotnet CLI, etc):

* Post any other relevant configuration settings here.
*   OS, architecture, etc.
-->
MSBuild: `Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 16.11.1+3e40a09f8 for .NET Framework`
NuGet: `NuGet Version: 4.1.0.2450`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Nuget pack adds deprecated 'licenseUrl' entry" (#12389) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

5.8.1, 6.1.0, 6.4.0

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

We have nuspec's, which looks like this example:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="Windows-1252"?>
<package>
  <metadata>
    <id>Test.License</id>
    <description>Test pack command</description>
    <version>1.2.3.4</version>
    <authors>not needed</authors>
    <copyright>Copyright @ 2023</copyright>
    <requireLicenseAcceptance>false</requireLicenseAcceptance>
    <dependencies>
      <!--
        Dependency to NUnit omitted on purpose, in case TestCaseReference attribute is not used.
      -->
    </dependencies>
    <license type="file">License.txt</license>
  </metadata>
  <files>
    <file src="./License.txt" target="" />
  </files>
</package>
```

Then this command is used:
(we have tested all nuget.exe versions from 5.8.1 to 6.4.0,)
nuget pack Test.License.nuspec

The nuspec of the generated nupkg:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<package xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/packaging/2011/08/nuspec.xsd">
  <metadata>
    <id>Test.License</id>
    <version>1.2.3.4</version>
    <authors>not needed</authors>
    <requireLicenseAcceptance>false</requireLicenseAcceptance>
    <license type="file">License.txt</license>
    <licenseUrl>https://aka.ms/deprecateLicenseUrl</licenseUrl>
    <description>Test pack command</description>
    <copyright>Copyright @ 2023</copyright>
  </metadata>
</package>
```

**Why is licenseUrl added? This entry is deprecated and we dont want to use it !**

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Make PackageReference the default in Visual Studio" (#12388) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: ### NuGet Product(s) Affected Visual Studio Package Management UI ### Current Behavior Currently in a fresh install of Visual Studio 2022, the default package management format is set to `Packages.config`. This tends to throw people off with certain project types that do support `PackageReference` which requires the user to figure out the current behavior, NuGet options, and change the default behavior after removing the `packages.config` file to restart. ### Desired Behavior We should change the default behavior to `PackageReference` in this dropdown. ### Additional Context _No response_

Until we figure out a plan, we should revert https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/9836b4469a575b6b1aa7c9072c28b2f4ef6ec91d.  The dev branch inserts into both .NET 7.0.2xx SDK and .NET 8.0.1xx SDK, but we only want the change for .NET 8 for now.

CC @aortiz-msft

Until we figure out a plan, we should revert https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/9836b4469a575b6b1aa7c9072c28b2f4ef6ec91d.  The dev branch inserts into both .NET 7.0.2xx SDK and .NET 8.0.1xx SDK, but we only want the change for .NET 8 for now.

CC @aortiz-msft

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Backport https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4850 to release-6.3.x (6.0.4xx)" (#12386) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
.NET 6.0.4xx SDK already backported a [change](https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/commit/dd40395b67e42c330397ba96308fd6817c070d67) that switched from the single CS+TS CTL to separate CS and TS CTL's.

We need to backport https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4850 to release-6.3.x.
This repo doesn't accept issues. Please see README.md in the root for more details.
